Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பலசொல்லக் காமுறுவர் மன்றமா சற்ற சிலசொல்லல் தேற்றா தவர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: They will desire to utter many words, who do not know how to speak a few faultless ones.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition. On the right, a wise speaker is shown uttering just a few, perfectly chosen words ('சிலசொல்லல்'). These words manifest as a small number of flawless, powerful, glowing diamonds.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the left, a foolish speaker, unable to produce such quality, is shown desperately trying to compensate with quantity. They are spewing forth a massive, chaotic torrent of many words ('பலசொல்ல'), which are visualized as a worthless flood of gravel and dust.
Layered_Composition.Background: An audience is shown turning away from the flood of gravel on the left and being drawn to the powerful, clear light of the few diamond-like words on the right.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Those who do not have the skill to speak a few, flawless words will try to cover their lack of quality with a confusing quantity of words.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The few, perfect diamond words vs. the massive flood of useless gravel is the central metaphor for quality over quantity in speech.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Contrasting, concise vs. verbose, valuable vs. worthless, wise vs. foolish.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The right side is lit by the brilliant, clear light of the diamond-words. The left side is dusty, chaotic, and poorly lit.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A balanced, side-by-side shot that makes the contrast in the value of the two speaking styles immediately obvious.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with high-quality particle effects for the gravel flood and crystal effects for the diamonds.

Cultural_Anchors: Many words ('பலசொல்ல') vs. A few faultless words ('மாசற்ற சிலசொல்லல்')
The desire of the unskilled to be verbose.
